placeInfo: {'id': '25983119', 'name': 'The Bellwood Manor', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 98, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.960976, 'longitude': 80.76671, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d25983119-Reviews-The_Bellwood_Manor-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebellwoodmanor.com', 'address': 'Badulla Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Badulla Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 1, 'count5': 98}}
text:
The property is a lovely 1920s colonial style manor house tastefully renovated and redecorated. It's right in the middle of the touristy area of Nuwara Eliya with entrance from the main A5 road which can get quite crowded on long weekends. But it's situated in a 2 acre property with the Single Tree mountain as their backdrop giving you enough space away from the crowds even on a long weekend. And we also felt that the property being slightly elevated and free from construction at the back made even the weather feel cooler than other downtown area. [Also helps that its right in the main road and you don't have to navigate some narrow winding road like most other properties in this area.]
I read on another review that this was one property where everything was exactly as advertised and I could not agree more. It is advertised as a luxury boutique hotel and luxury is exactly what you get, with the expensive furniture and fittings used, the very professional, courteous and well dressed staff, the six course dinner, complimentary sauna, steam room and the plunge pool cum jacuzzi...  the list goes on....
Should also specifically mention how they've paid attention to even the little things like the welcome garlands, the chocolates in the room, the mini charcuterie in the sauna, access to their own Netflix account in the room tv, complimentary soft drinks in the mini fridge, a luxury tea brand in the room...
Think the property has about six rooms, we took the junior suite which was very spacious. It had a large bedroom cum tv area and an equally large bathroom cum dressing room. 
All rooms get a complimentary one hour use of their sauna, steam room and temperature controlled jacuzzi cum plunge pool which was absolutely heavenly in that weather. 
We went on HB basis. The dinner was a set menu of a six course fine dining meal. During our check in itself the  chef came and spoke to us about our preferences from the options available within the set menu. Since my husband was a vegetarian, the chef came up with a seperated menu altogether curated for vegetarians! 
The dinner service worked like clockwork. The presentation was lovely and the chef came to each and every table and did an explanation about the ingredients each time a dish was served. So it was not like any other dinner, you also get a tasting menu type of experience of course with larger portion sizes. Both of us loved our main, the beef steak and the veg steak. While I love Japanse and I loved the taste of the sushi appetizer served, I felt it didn't let me do justice to my main;) 
The breakfast had two options. Western and traditional. We picked one of each. The Western was perfect. Also loved the hoppers with the egg cooked exactly as it should be cooked. But if I am nitpicking, I would recommend that a few more accompaniments be included for the traditional meal and coffee/ tea pot be placed at the table instead being served to a cup.
There was a nice looking bar, but sadly we visited on a poya day and it was closed. 
Must also mention that the service was exemplary. From the Manager, the reception staff, the chef, the restaurant staff, the housekeeping staff. They were friendly, courteous and ever ready to assist. In fact when we checked out, most of the staff came to the entrance to send us off which we thought was very sweet of them. 
Would highly recommend this palce and obviously, we cannot wait to go back!
title: A luxurious experience

placeInfo: {'id': '25983119', 'name': 'The Bellwood Manor', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 98, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.960976, 'longitude': 80.76671, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d25983119-Reviews-The_Bellwood_Manor-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thebellwoodmanor.com', 'address': 'Badulla Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Badulla Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 1, 'count5': 98}}
roomTip: Just book it! You will not be disappointed.
text: What an incredible stay we have had at Bellwood Manor. The building itself is absolutely stunning and has been recently restored to a very high standard. Our room was large, with a comfortable bed and all amenities you could wish for. The hotel is perfectly located on the edge of the town centre, a short walk or tuk tuk ride away from the hustle and bustle. And the perfect base to explore the incredible tea plantations. The landscape is spectacular and really does take your breath away. The food prepared by the chefs was nothing short of excellent - you will not go hungry here! We had lunch, a 6 course tasting dinner and also the most delicious breakfast we could ask for. All food is home made and in abundance, made with the freshest, tastiest ingredients. My personal favourites were the cauliflower and cashew nut soup at dinner, fresh home made breads, and the breakfast granola! All delicious. There is a well stocked bar with plenty of imported spirits too. The grounds are immaculately tended to, and the grass looks like a golf course! But the real thing that makes this hotel is the staff. They are warm, welcoming, attentive and charming. They could not do enough for us. Thank you so much to Yomal, Yanaka, and the team for being the perfect hosts in this home away from home. We really cannot thank you enough. Without a doubt with this is the place to stay when visiting Nuwara Eliya. An experience we will never forget. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay.
title: The perfect stay

text:
3 night stay. Everything was excellent. 

Room - well appointed, very comfortable bed, kept pristine by the room fairies (who we never saw).

Food - wonderful half board dinner and breakfast.

Surroundings - I want to live in a house like this. Beautifully appointed inside and wonderful relaxing gardens.

Team - could not do enough for us. From the welcome, room service and especially the restaurant team, we received warm and friendly service.

Spa - available for private use. We booked in advance and used each day. Very warm plunge pool with hot steam room.
title: Wonderful 3 night stay

text:
Truly a 5-star! Bellwood Manor feels more like a welcoming home than a run of the mill hotel. The staffs were exceptionally attentive, catering to our every need with warmth.

Janaka, the restaurant manager, who was always there with a smile, ensuring we felt right at home every moment. His genuine hospitality made our stay even more memorable.

The food here really is one of the best we had during our whole stay in Sri Lanka. The Chef takes great pride in only using local ingredients to produce some truly excellent dishes. 

If we ever find ourselves in Nuwara Eliya again, there's no doubt we'll be staying at Bellwood Manor. Simply unparalleled!
title: A home away from home at The Bellwood Manor

text:
The team of the Bellwood manor went above and beyond to make our stay memorable! 

You are in for a treat! You are going to be staying in a beautifully renovated British villa and they managed to preserve the old Charme and added some elegant new furniture. They even kept the light switches from back on the days, look out for them- amazing :)

There is a spa area which you can book on an hourly basis for private access. They also organised horse riding for me which was 5.000LkR per hour and a former jockey took me for a two hour tour though the area and tea plantations. 

Rooms are up to European standards! Absolutely beautiful with Netflix in all rooms and big showers. 

We can absolutely recommend staying here! Plan for time in the hotel - you will love it â¤ï¸
title: Beautiful English villa in the middle of Sri Lanka

text:
Wow what an unbelievable experience! Bellwood Manor truely is a magical place. From the moment we first arrived we were warmly welcomed with friendly smiles and refreshments. The room is immaculate and spacious, and the in-room refreshments were refilled throughout our stay. We purchased the half board package and were surprised at how delicious all the food was! On our arrival we were greeted by the chef who talked us through the 6 course dinner planned for that evening. The food was exceptional. Breakfast the following morning was just as delicious - you wonâ€™t leave this place hungry!

The property is a delight. We really enjoyed spending time in the spa/steam room which you can book on the hour to have the entire space to yourself. 

Most importantly, the staff were highly professional, friendly and welcoming. They made sure we always felt looked after and were very happy to chat with us about how to make the most of our time in the area. I would love to come back one day and would recommend Bellwood Manor to all my friends and family. My only complaint is that I wish we had stayed longer!
title: The perfect mansion! An unforgettable stay.

text:
We just spent two incredible nights at Bellwood Manor, and it was truly an unforgettable experience! This charming boutique hotel, with only eight rooms, offers a unique and intimate atmosphere that feels like a hidden gem.

We stayed in the luxury suite with a private balcony, and it was absolutely stunning. The interior was beautifully designed, showcasing elegance and comfort in every detail. The moment we arrived, we felt right at home.

The dining experience was one of the highlights of our stay. The chef prepared amazing and unique dishes, Each meal was delicious and beautifully presented, consisting of three or more courses, from a delightful amuse-bouche to exquisite desserts. He took the time to explain each dish, making the experience even more enjoyable. Every meal was simply perfect!

The service was exceptional. Janaka, really made our stay special with his warm smile and attentive care. He went above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed, and his cheerful personality added to the welcoming ambiance..

We also loved the indoor pool,steam room and sauna, which provided a perfect way to unwind and relax. 

Overall, I canâ€™t recommend Bellwood Manor enough! Itâ€™s a perfect 10/10 for a cozy luxury getaway in Nuwara Eliya. We can't wait to return!
title: 10/10 Recommend!

text:
We had a wonderful stay at Golden Ridge Nuwaraeliya, a stunning location with amazing views, and I must say that everything was beyond our expectations. Facilities were of the highest standards and views across the hotel to the mountains were incredible.

At the time of check-in, we were warmly welcomed by the front office staff (Thakshila, Nuran & Heshan) and for the welcome drink, they had 3 varieties, including a hot milk coffee called Nutty Coffee which was superb.

We got a room on the top floor (5th floor). The room had a magnificent view of mountains including the famous Pidurutalagala mountain range. The room was clean and all the required amenities were there. 

All the 3 meals we had were buffet style at The Clovelly Restaurant. The staff at the Clovelly Restaurant was very helpful and pleasant. They arranged us a nice table overlooking the mountains and I should say that was a truly remarkable experience. The food was exceptional and very tasty. They have a huge variety of food including separate corners for International, Sri Lankan, Indian, Japanese, Chinese and it can definitely be ranked as an International Buffet.

The main swimming pool of the hotel was an indoor heated pool and the view from the pool was stunning.

The entire hotel has been designed without harming the environment. There is a small waterfall on the hotel land, and we visited their strawberry and vegetable farms too. The view from the top of the hotel was mesmerizing.

Finally, thank you Golden Ridge Nuwaraeliya for making our stay unforgettable. We will definitely be visiting there again.
title: Truly unforgettable stay

placeInfo: {'id': '15039915', 'name': 'The Golden Ridge Hotel', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1187, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.982058, 'longitude': 80.75417, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d15039915-Reviews-The_Golden_Ridge_Hotel-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thegoldenridge.com/', 'address': '395 Bambarakelle Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '395 Bambarakelle Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 11, 'count2': 8, 'count3': 18, 'count4': 89, 'count5': 1067}}
text:
Our first time visiting Sri Lanka, and Nuwara Eliya, and we were so happy to call The Golden Ridge hotel home. 

From the moment we checked in, we knew the hotel was special. Little touches like a doorman to greet you, welcome drink cart rolled to you while check in formalities are taken, cold towels to greet you, and a relaxing area to sit while the front desk completed check in were greatly appreciated. 

We were assigned room 4003 which was nicely adorned with a large king bed, a welcome amenity of some cookies, and a decent sized bathroom. Note, due to the elevation of the hotel, there's no AC (you won't need it anyways), but each room has nice fire places with artificial logs, but they do provide some nice heat. 

The hotel is spread across a decent campus. The hotel and dining room in one, and then up a short pathway to recreation building, which houses the gym, spa, and indoor heated pool. I took advantage of the spa during the stay and the 'Taste of Sri Lanka' was heavenly - it included a 60 minute massage, 60 minute body scrub and mud bath. It was so lovely, and the spa therapists are Balinese and know what they're doing! 

We had dinner and breakfast included in our brief one night stay, and both were elaborate dining experiences. While meals are buffet style, the buffets are EXTENSIVE, with over 50+ offerings, and many made-to-order specialities. I really commend the chef and the culinary team for putting so much effort into each meal - taste, presentation, and quality were all impeccable. 

Overall, a great stay at The Golden Ridge hotel, and it helped make our first trip to Sri Lanka memorable. Highly recommend - it's nestled in a quiet area and away from town, and a beautiful place to relax and enjoy the region!
title: Luxury in the hills of Nuwara Eliya

ownerResponse:
{'id': '974244673', 'text': 'Dear valued guest ,

Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback regarding your recent stay with us at The Golden Ridge. We genuinely appreciate your insights, as they are invaluable in helping us enhance our service.

We are particularly concerned about your comments regarding air conditioning. Due to the naturally cooler climate in Nuwara Eliya, certain rooms on our property are designed without air conditioning, as heating is typically required for guest comfort. We strive to provide transparent information to both our booking agents and on our online platforms to ensure our guests are well-informed prior to their arrival. I hope you had the opportunity to review this information during your booking process. If you had intended to request a room with air conditioning, I kindly ask you to discuss this matter further with your booking agent. They can assist you in exploring the possibility of changing to an air-conditioned room category; please be aware that this may involve an additional cost. However, we understand that you have chosen to decline this option.

I would also like to remind you that upon check-in, our reception staff clearly communicated that the minibar is available upon request. Unfortunately, it seems we did not receive any requests for minibar service during your stay.

Additionally, I understand you had concerns regarding the IPTV service. To clarify, we offer more than 9 local channels and 41 international channels for your viewing pleasure, and we were surprised to hear that this was not noted during your stay.

Furthermore, we are disheartened to hear about your interactions with our staff at both reception and in the restaurant. It is unacceptable for any guest to feel disregarded or treated rudely, and we will address this matter with our team immediately to reinforce our commitment to exceptional customer service.

We truly appreciate your feedback, as it helps us improve our services. Should you have any further concerns or if there is anything we can do to assist you, please feel free to reach out to our Operations Manager at om@thegoldenridge.com.

Thank you once again for your valuable input, and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you better in the future.

Best regards,

Pushpitha Udawatte
General Manager', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-17', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
placeInfo: {'id': '15039915', 'name': 'The Golden Ridge Hotel', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1187, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.982058, 'longitude': 80.75417, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d15039915-Reviews-The_Golden_Ridge_Hotel-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thegoldenridge.com/', 'address': '395 Bambarakelle Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '395 Bambarakelle Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 11, 'count2': 8, 'count3': 18, 'count4': 89, 'count5': 1067}}
text:
I am currently in the facility and I'm totally disgusted that it is promoted as a five star facility.
Reasons for not considering it 5 star
1. The main building family room has no air-conditioning.  I couldn't sleep the entire night. When I complained the  general manager pushpitha  put it on the agency's head who did the booking. What kind of a facility gets 5 star rating with half of the rooms not having air-conditioning. It's only the mountain chalets which have the air conditioning. The reason given for no air-conditioning is Nuwara eliya is cool and there is heater provided.  So beware when you book. My family could not sleep the entire night and we were provided fans. So it's a 5 star facility with fans.
2. The mini bar is kept empty.  Another criteria for being 5 star is a mini bar stocked up. Here it's empty.
3. Staff at reception and restaurant were rude and without empathy and a lot of arrogance. 
4. In the restaurant I asked for a spoon. The server Sampath gave me one and while handing over remarked you will find more in the restaurant so take it. He then delayed the coffee I asked for just ignoring my request. I then went to Sumu the restaurant supervisor who got me the coffee soon enough. This level of disregard for customer is not acceptable in the 5 star Hotel industry
5. They advertise IpTV with multiple channels. You will actually get 4 or 4 Srilankan channels. Rest you get message as  not subscribed.
I would not recommend this hotel. If you are a seasoned traveller used to 5 star luxury you will certainly find my comments worth your while.
title: Not a 5 star rated facility if you compare with 5 star criteria

text:
I had maybe the best service in life at Aralia Green Hills. The staff was friendly, helpful and went out of their way to explain how my room worked and that I had a great time overall. Special thanks to Marcus and Chef Charitha for the delicious food.
They explained what each dish was and gave great recommendations.

The rooms were very nice with heating which was nice during the cold night. The grounds were beautiful and well manicured and everything was so clean.
Thanks for a wonderful stay and special thanks to Marcus for the tips and advice and Shiyamana for the hotel tour

text:
I fell in love with the hotel and its surroundings the moment our car rounded the bend. It was serene and peaceful. You'll get a warm welcome the moment you step out of your vehicle. The rooms were cozy, and the manual lift to your floor will make you feel like you're traveling through time. The activities hosted by the management were pleasant. The food was mediocre, but the ambiance and service more than made up for it. The whole hotel is run mostly by Tamils, and I felt right at home.

I will be back!!
title: Gem of Nuwara Eliya

placeInfo: {'id': '496624', 'name': 'Heritance Tea Factory', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4543, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.991238, 'longitude': 80.833755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d496624-Reviews-Heritance_Tea_Factory-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.aitkenspencehotels.com/teafactory/', 'address': 'Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kandapola', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 91, 'count3': 289, 'count4': 1028, 'count5': 3083}}
roomTip: A special dinner - must go.
text:
For a truly unique travel experience in Sri Lanka, this stunning hotel, perched 1,600 meters high in the sky above a lush plantation, is an unforgettable destination in Nuwara Eliya. The hotel's upcycled factory design blends industrial charm with captivating views and rich historical displays. However, it's the incredible staff, who take great pride in their work, that truly make the stay memorable.

Nobet â€“ Nobet, the "stationmaster" of the special dining car, brings a playful and whimsical touch to the entire dining experience. With a dining table designed inside a vintage train car, thereâ€™s a certain magic to the meal that I won't spoil here, but let's just say it feels incredibly authentic. The attention to detail and Nobetâ€™s humor create a relaxing and delightful experience that kept us smiling throughout the evening. His interaction with guests, full of clever nods and a few surprises, made dinner a true highlight of our stay. Importantly, he truly enjoys hir role - that makes guests happy.

Nitharshan â€“ The eight-course dinner was a culinary journey in itself, and the main dish, a perfectly cooked lobster, was a revelation. To enjoy French cuisine in such a remote mountain setting was beyond what I could have imagined before arriving here. The chef personally visited our table twice during the meal, and the next morning at the buffet, he made a point of engaging with us again. Upon learning my wife loves mangoes, he cut a rare local variety right at the table and served it to her, offering an incredibly personal and heartwarming touch that made us feel truly valued.

Jayanthi â€“ The knowledgable tea lady guided us through a tea-picking and tasting experience that was both educational and deeply immersive. With over 20 years of experience in the tea industry, she shared her knowledge with a sense of pride and passion that left a lasting impression. Her methodical yet engaging explanations not only taught us about tea, but also instilled a deeper appreciation for it. Thanks to her, I now have insights into tea that I will carry with me for a lifetime. What value this experience left to me. From her careful guidance during the tea-picking process to the nuanced tasting session, Jayanthi's expertise made the experience more than just an activityâ€”it was an opportunity to connect with the heritage of Sri Lankan tea on a deeper level. Her professionalism and warmth were remarkable, leaving us with newfound appreciation and knowledge that will enrich every cup of tea we brew in the future.

In summary, this hotel offers far more than just luxurious accommodations and stunning views. Itâ€™s a place where the dedication and enthusiasm of the staff elevate your stay into a once-in-a-lifetime experience. The blend of history, charm, and personalized service makes this destination truly special. Whether youâ€™re savoring exquisite cuisine, exploring the rich tea culture, or enjoying the delightful surprises during dinner, this is a journey that will stay with you long after you leave.
title: Sri Lankan Pride, Heartfelt Hospitality, and Unforgettable Moments with Remarkable People

placeInfo: {'id': '496624', 'name': 'Heritance Tea Factory', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4543, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.991238, 'longitude': 80.833755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d496624-Reviews-Heritance_Tea_Factory-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.aitkenspencehotels.com/teafactory/', 'address': 'Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kandapola', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 91, 'count3': 289, 'count4': 1028, 'count5': 3083}}
roomTip: Remember to pack a light jumper as it can get cool at night
text:
Set in a lovely location and it was like turning the clock back but having all of the modern comforts. 
Our stay was for three nights which is a little long. Two nights would have been perfect. 
Great room and very comfortable, however, the bathroom was very cold and if you want to shower before dinner donâ€™t expect only warm not  hot water!
When checking in we were asked for any special diet requirements. This was encouraging as we both need gluten free. Unfortunately, this was not passed on to the chefs. On our last evening the head chef did guide us around the buffet highlighting what was gluten free. Be aware some labels are noted gluten free but many are not when they should be. However, the food was very good, particularly the dosa at breakfast. 
We had a guided tour of the tea factory which explained the process from when the leaves are picked until the end of the process. 
The gardens are outstanding and maintained and a pleasure to walk around taking in the clear fresh air. 
A big shout out must go to Wasantha who cleaned our room daily, the friendly gentleman who looked after our cases and the waiters in the restaurant. 
A good stay but remember to take a jumper at it is quite a bit cooler up there!
title: A good short visit

placeInfo: {'id': '496624', 'name': 'Heritance Tea Factory', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4543, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.991238, 'longitude': 80.833755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d496624-Reviews-Heritance_Tea_Factory-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.aitkenspencehotels.com/teafactory/', 'address': 'Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kandapola', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 91, 'count3': 289, 'count4': 1028, 'count5': 3083}}
text:
Simply the best!

Heritance tea factory has it all - Great location, Great property , Great people , Excellent processes and right incentives to ensure it's employees give the best possible service. 

You will be greeted by smiling muthuswamy at the reception at anytime of the day.

The restaurant helmed by Manoj, Kesawan and other excellent waiters ensure you feel pampered.

Jayprakash in housekeeping will ensure you cannot crib about room service even if you have ocd .

Indah and other masseuse from Bali will.make sure your spa experience puts you to a relaxed sleep. 

Krishnaveni on tea plucking tour will make you pick over 100 grams of tea with her brisk pace and enthusiasm. Along the way know about the 7 steps that lead you to your cup of tea.

Finally whoever has Landscaped the garden has again done a great job. It is very thoughtful to have so many small sitouts and hideouts. These create an amazing picnicking feel to the entire experience.

I am from tamil.nadu and the icing on the cake is everybody speaks tamil so you don't feel homesick.

If you have grown on a staple diet of enid Blyton books and are seeking tranquility look no further.

Hats off to heritance..they have added tremendous value to this property via branding, digital.marketing  and operational excellence.  I hope they are earning the appropriate reward for that!

P.S: Don't miss their high tea, It was fabulous.
title: Stairway to Heaven

text:
Amazing hotel with amazing features, stayed one night as part of our Ceylon tour. Room had brilliant views with everything provided that you would need. Loads of history in the hotel and a generator which was turned on for visitors on a night. 
Went on the tea factory tour with Krishnaveni who was an excellent guide.  The gardens were lovely, with amazing views and had a lovely golf putting green. 
Afternoon tea looked amazing and had we been staying another night would have loved to have tried it. 
All the staff were amazing so helpful and friendly, the food was lovely with plenty of choice.
If you get the chance to stay at this hotel I would highly recommend it just for the wonderful experience it offers.
title: Amazing hotel

Weâ€™ve already decided to return for a longer stay next time, as one night wasnâ€™t enough to fully enjoy everything.

roomTip: Stay longer!
text:
Out of 5 hotelâ€™s we stayed in throughout Sri Lanka, Heritance Hotel was my favorite hotel. It provided the best personal service! They maintained the traditional colonial type of character to it but it was upgraded. The location of it was secluded and so peaceful. My only regret was that I didnâ€™t stay there longer! 
The rooms were spacious and comfortable. But for me the people working there made my stay extra special. All the staff were very honest and helpful! In particular Jayanthi (tea picking/tasting expert), Norbetraja (the server) and Shamu (the chef) made my stay from great to incredible. They all just seemed like they LOVED their jobs and they were amazing at it too. 
As soon as we got to the hotel we signed up the tea picking and tasting tour. Jayanthi hosted this service and was incredibly knowledgeable and explained the process well. Sheâ€™s done this for several years and you could see her love and passion for the role. She was so personal and had great banter. She had this warmth which made me feel like I was home with family. Even for someone who doesnâ€™t like tea I really the experience and Jayanthi was a big part of it!
Norbetraja was incredibly welcoming with his infectious smile and energy. He spent time with us to talk and had great jokes. He was happy to help whenever we needed something even if he was doing another job/role. He really went above and beyond this role! He again looked like he loved talking to others and loved his job. Felt like a personal service once again! 
As soon as I walked in for dinner, Shamu the chef, approached me with a big smile and gave a great welcome. He showed me the vast options of vegetarian food in the buffet which all tasted delicious. I told him that I have been loving one of the dishes while being in Sri-Lanka and would love to make it. Without asking he took the time to write up the recipe so I could make this home! I canâ€™t thank him enough and I look forward to making this at home. Thank you to Shamu! 
Overall I loved being here. I would have loved to have stay there longer!
title: Personal experience exceeded expectations

text:
Great location, excellent staff, warm and delicious food. What else would one expect to spend an enjoyable holiday...

Another unique theam by Heritance Hotels... A real tea factory in the 1900s (which produced the best tea for London tea auctions) converted to a 55-room hotel. 

The tea from the estate surrounding the hotel can be experienced at any time during the day...loved the tea they arranged to the rooms in the mornings and evenings..

Thank you, Heritance Tea Factory, for your wonderful hospitality. Special thanks to front office staff , all waiters and restaurant staff, and the lovely ladies at mini tea factory. 

Until next time..
title: Breathing fresh air...

text:
We visited Heritance as part of our tour of Sri Lanka and stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is unique with a lot of nicely restored industrial heritage from its history as a tea factory. The staff are all very friendly and attentive. We had the buffet dinner in the first night and paid extra for a tasting menu on the second night. All of the meals including breakfast and an afternoon tea for lunch were superb. There are some activities which you can arrange with the hotel and we spent the day enjoying the unique location in the mountains and didnâ€™t feel the need to venture further. The tea picking experience was really fun and unique getting dressed up in traditional clothes was part of the experience and our guide, Krishnaveni made the experience a lot of fun.
We also had a nature walk in the evening with Mohanraj who took us around one of the hills near the hotel via some of the local villages. He was very knowledgeable about all of the local history and wildlife and it was something different for the end of the day.
title: Great experience at a Unique Hotel in a stunning location!

2 nights max as there is no pool.

text:
Overall a really nice place to stay. Our room was great and very spacious. The tea tour with picking was excellent, Krishnaveni was a great host.
Service was very good especially Youaraj who was personable and polite. 
Location is idyllic however you are 5km from any shop or town which some people could find annoying. 2 nights here max.
One thing to mention is the rail cart. This will cost you $100 each which they try to upsell immediately on your arrival. The member of staff who was upselling this we just found so unnecessary and rude so something to note.
Overall really positive and enjoyed our stay.
title: Peaceful, quiet and a great view

placeInfo: {'id': '496624', 'name': 'Heritance Tea Factory', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4543, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.991238, 'longitude': 80.833755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d496624-Reviews-Heritance_Tea_Factory-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.aitkenspencehotels.com/teafactory/', 'address': 'Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kandapola', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 91, 'count3': 289, 'count4': 1028, 'count5': 3083}}
text: Here you will find traces of Colonial Sri Lanka. The tea factory has been sensitively converted. The setting is beautiful, food delicious and staff outstanding. This is not the place to make excursions from- the road up is long- but it makes for a lovely break for a night or two with temperatures lower and more bearable. For a charge you can be shown how the tea is harvested or go for a nature walk. There is a putting green, volley ball, a childrenâ€™s play area and a gym. Rooms are clean and comfortable with stunning views. Credit must go to the Chef who was most attentive and helpful in making sure that I ate a gluten free diet. As with everywhere in Sri Lanka make sure you have some small notes for tipping!
title: Sri Lanka of yesteryear

placeInfo: {'id': '496624', 'name': 'Heritance Tea Factory', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4543, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.991238, 'longitude': 80.833755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d496624-Reviews-Heritance_Tea_Factory-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.aitkenspencehotels.com/teafactory/', 'address': 'Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kandapola', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 91, 'count3': 289, 'count4': 1028, 'count5': 3083}}
roomTip: Donâ€™t spend more than two nights. Avoid the spa and gym, itâ€™s dated, and poorly maintained. The best rooms end in 08 or 09. Drink Yara tea!
text:
Overall we had a great stay at the hotel and would consider coming back, definitely for lunch. 

Check-in: We had a very wholesome and warm welcome to the hotel thanks to Muthusamy. His humor and enthusiasm set the tone for our entire trip. We are very grateful, it was a certainly special start to a tiring and long drive. We were treated so well on arrival!

Food and beverages: The quality of food has been the best during our stay in Sri Lanka so far. We were celebrating an occasion so a cake was provided, turns out many folks come to the hotel for the same reason so it felt less special / unique. 

Location: Just pure awesome. We enjoyed incredible views the entire time we stayed at the hotel. 

Rooms: Rooms are dated but come with very good views. 

Staff: Hotel staff were phenomenal all around, from Muthusamyâ€™s porter crew to kitchen, to Isai in housekeeping to flower garden, tea factory experience and so on. Majority of the staff were cordial and pleasant including the trainees.

Spa: Given the setting of the hotel the expectations of the spa was very high (we had recently stayed at 98 acres in Ella where we had a massage overlooking a tea plantation). Unfortunately this is not the case at HTF. The spa is dated, overpriced and the setting feels like the back of an office building. Lost opportunity IMO. Would not recommend the spa to anyone. 

Check-out: The staff were very fast and the experience was painless. Bills were explained clearly and they also provided us tea as souvenirs. Since we checked out early they also promptly provided us with boxed lunch for the road.
title: Definitely visit for the lunch and the tea tour, if you choose to spend the night donâ€™t do more than 2 nights!

text:
Really beautiful location, thatâ€™s it.
When we arrived in the room we noticed the sheets and the pillow had yellow and black stains, the shower tub doesnâ€™t drain the water and there is a lot of dust around the room and the hotel.
We were a group of 20 ppl and they forced us to have a set dinner menu (â‚¬65 each person, way too expensive) instead of letting us use the buffet with the explanation that â€˜we were too manyâ€™, honestly I donâ€™t see their point but we didnâ€™t want to argue. Moreover the aperitivo was way too expensive for the quality of the wine they offer. Some of the staff member was very polite, other not at all.
Anyway the tea experience was fun.
The reception guy offered us to change room and the chef was caring for the ppl who has allergies and the ones who didnâ€™t want to eat local food.

placeInfo: {'id': '496624', 'name': 'Heritance Tea Factory', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4543, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.991238, 'longitude': 80.833755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d496624-Reviews-Heritance_Tea_Factory-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.aitkenspencehotels.com/teafactory/', 'address': 'Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kandapola', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 91, 'count3': 289, 'count4': 1028, 'count5': 3083}}
text:
Okay let's start with the good 
Location is excellent and peaceful, great views
Rooms are fine as to be expected
Food was very good

Okay for the problems 
The moment you walk through the door they try to upsell you
Tours are this
Spa is this
Dinning carriage is this, well the dinning carriage is a joke. 130usd for an 8 course menu which looks to serve very similar to the buffet
This was on top of whatever board basis you were on. I would have expected a supplement charge depending on your room basis.
Service was dreadful. Although staff are very polite, never removed our plates we had to stack them on a nearby table. As although the tables are adequate they are quite small
Some desserts are served in a shot glass however no tea spoons are provided so I less you use your fingers cannot eat it.
When we asked for tea spoons the look of disgust from staff was in believe
Reception service os poor. Twice we had to asked for something to fix something the room as never turned up first time
Twice we had to ask for a porter to help with checkout. Yet when try move bags yourselves they are very upset

Overall it's not a 4 staff it's a 3 star trying to be a 5 star.

If you want to go for the experience that's fine as location is great
 However if feel they need to re look at themselves and make some changes.
title: Trying to be something it's not

text: We were at the Heritance for two nights. As you enter the place you feel like you are in a different era. Service is outstanding. They really make you feel at home. text:
An overnight stay in Heritance Tea Factory was a unique heritage experience. The rooms were large and comfortable which was a welcome relief after a long day of sightseeing. The hotel still has many original features from its factory days which makes it a unique place, including original working features which are amazing to see in operation. The buffet was great with plenty of choice, which given the hotels remote location is a great feature. A minor point - there aren't many sockets in the room, so if you have lots of tech that you need to charge bring a multi-port socket with you. 

Great experience which we will remember for a long time.
title: Heritage visit in a unique location

placeInfo: {'id': '579216', 'name': "Jetwing St.Andrew's", 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2408, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.979285, 'longitude': 80.76378, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d579216-Reviews-Jetwing_St_Andrew_s-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingstandrews/', 'address': 'No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 79, 'count2': 129, 'count3': 372, 'count4': 916, 'count5': 912}}
text:
Our stay at Jetwings @ St Andrews was nothing short of extraordinary, and I cannot recommend this place enough!
From the moment we arrived, the level of service was impeccable. Check-in was smooth and quick, and we were welcomed with a hot face towelâ€”such a thoughtful touch! A staff member personally escorted us to our room, where she explained everything about the amenities. Located on a picturesque mountain surrounded by tea plantations, the hotel has a serene and refreshing atmosphere. Although the room didnâ€™t have a fan or mini fridge initially, the team quickly exceeded our expectations. A staff member came by for turn-down service and, upon request, arranged for both a standing fan and a mini fridge. By the time we returned from dinner, both had been delivered to our room! Such attention to detail and a genuine willingness to meet our needs made our stay truly remarkable.
Speaking of dinner, we had a fantastic five-course meal at Asion Restaurant. Every dish was beautifully plated and tasted delicious. Our server, Mr. Nisal, provided flawless serviceâ€”he remembered our orders perfectly, and everything was served without a single mistake. We felt so well taken care of, and the ambiance of the restaurant made the evening special. Special thanks to Ms. Gowry, who checked in on us during dinner to ensure we were enjoying everything.
What really touched us was how the staff went above and beyond the next morning. My husband wasnâ€™t feeling well and had to skip breakfast. When the staff at Asion Restaurant learned of this, they packed him a sandwich bag with a packet of chocolate milk to go! It was such a thoughtful gesture and truly reflective of the care and attention the hotel gives to its guests.
Jetwings @ St Andrews is not just a place to stayâ€”itâ€™s an experience filled with warmth, care, and personalized service. We had such a memorable time, and weâ€™ll definitely be back! Highly recommended for anyone looking to relax in a beautiful setting with exceptional hospitality
title: Touches in a Beautiful Mountain Retreat!

placeInfo: {'id': '579216', 'name': "Jetwing St.Andrew's", 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2408, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.979285, 'longitude': 80.76378, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d579216-Reviews-Jetwing_St_Andrew_s-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingstandrews/', 'address': 'No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 79, 'count2': 129, 'count3': 372, 'count4': 916, 'count5': 912}}
text: We got a gift voucher for 2 at Jetwing St.Andrews hotel for a night stay full board. We decided to book a room for 3 and when we went there we needed a more spacious room. We are happy to tell that the staff was very friendly and after accepting our request they upgraded the room from superior to deluxe attic. Special thanks goes to Mr.Clive for that. Also, it was not difficult to book the hotel online via email. Quick response, which any guest would expect. We loved the stay at this beautiful hotel.
title: We recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to have a relaxing and peaceful place to stay with their loved ones.

text: This felt like home with the added touch of indulgence and luxury.  The hotel is beautiful with stunning manicured lawns and gardens which just  call out to be photographed. The reception areas all have real fireplaces which are lit in the evenings with burning logs to give that extra cozy feeling on the cooler evenings. The staff are all so welcoming and canâ€™t do enough to make you feel relaxed and special. I would like to mention a few in particular who went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable and relaxed and they are Inoch, Gayan, Rusinu, Gahas and Shane in the bar area and Umesh, Malisha and Alen in the restaurant. I send you all a special thank you for your kind and considerate attention during our 2 night stay in the most beautiful room 301 which we were very grateful to have been assigned. We wish you all continued success.
title: Number one choice for Nuwara Eliya

text: Very good, although somewhat pricey colonial style hotel with excellent service. Especially to mention Mrs Gowry who toke very good care of us during our stay. Very nice restaurant with excellent food. Excellent bar and lounge with cosy fireplace as it may get a bit chilly in this area. If you plan to have breakfast and dinner, we would recommend booking your meal plan/ half board in advance as the on-spot prices are more expensive.
title: Great hotel and service

placeInfo: {'id': '579216', 'name': "Jetwing St.Andrew's", 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2408, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.979285, 'longitude': 80.76378, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d579216-Reviews-Jetwing_St_Andrew_s-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingstandrews/', 'address': 'No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 79, 'count2': 129, 'count3': 372, 'count4': 916, 'count5': 912}}
text:
The service of that gorgeous place was perfectly defined by Herbert Coorays Philosophy . But honourary mention the staff at the lobby with efficiency defined. 
The amazing service I found in my humble opinion could never be found in any other part of the country. The homey feel of the hotel left me doubting whether I was in a hotel or right at home in Yorkshire. The experience made me wishing for a longer stay but like all things they must come to an end. But in summary if you happen to look at my review for even a brief second I couldn't less define the philosophy of Herbert Cooray than the example of the hotel I am reviewing today. The hotel defines the word practicality and sofistication. But if I were to recommend any activity if you were blessed with opportunity to read his autobiography it would be a must recommend
title: The best hotel I have been too

placeInfo: {'id': '579216', 'name': "Jetwing St.Andrew's", 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2408, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.979285, 'longitude': 80.76378, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d579216-Reviews-Jetwing_St_Andrew_s-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingstandrews/', 'address': 'No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 79, 'count2': 129, 'count3': 372, 'count4': 916, 'count5': 912}}
text: The warmth and hospitality of the staff at Jetwing St Andrews was felt immediately upon our arrival, making the biting cold around us feel miniscule in comparison. The front office staff were young efficient and invited us immediately with a soothing warm soup which was unexpected but welcome. Particularly one of the staff Vishnu was a great help to us during this trip. He was kind and charismatic and took it to his personal efforts to lead us on a guided tour of the grounds. The rooms were beautiful and had a lovely homely vibe- with soft carpets, luxurious robes and a pretty theme throughout. A "Little English feel" was immediately apparent. The food was quite splendid and delicious and we found a large variety to choose from with every meal. And the gardens! Beautifully kept and maintained we found ourselves repeatedly going outside to admire the scenery that St Andrews boasted with such pride. The biography of Jetwing's founder Herbert Cooray in each room is also highly recommended to read if you get the chance. In short, St. Andrews is a stunning hotel for visitors of any kind showcasing the best of Nuwara Eliya. We will be back! Thank you so much.
title: An eye-catching homely stay with top notch service

text:

We enjoyed tasty buffets and a carte lunch on departure day. 
Had a memorable time near the fireplace and enjoyed nicely maintained hotel front garden. 
Hotel staff are well trained and helpful 
Our family room with attic was very nice.
title: Nice hotel at Nuwaraeliya, with very good service

placeInfo: {'id': '579216', 'name': "Jetwing St.Andrew's", 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2408, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.979285, 'longitude': 80.76378, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d579216-Reviews-Jetwing_St_Andrew_s-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingstandrews/', 'address': 'No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 79, 'count2': 129, 'count3': 372, 'count4': 916, 'count5': 912}}
text: Beautiful traditional colonial type mansion that has been tastefully extended. Gardens are quite special, (we didn't get the full benefit of the grounds as it rained for most of our 2 day stay) Rooms are quite traditional and perhaps due to age of the building don't have air conditioning and heating is a plug in electric heater which was certainly needed during our stay. On our last night wee did have to contact reception about a lack of hot water. Food was again buffet style, adequate but perhaps not as good as some of the previous hotels we stayed at in Sri Lanka. The bar area is okay, a little dark and a bit chilly, rather odd to see people huddled around open fires in the evening in the bar or lounge. We felt bar and service charges here were a little more than we had become accustomed too. We an early start 5:30 am to hike Horton Plains and the hotel offered a packed breakfast. This was really appreciated but they forgot to do it and this delayed the start of our drive to the plains. Would I stay again, probably yes, but it'd be at a time when the weather was better.
title: Beautiful location, but a chilly stay in offseason

text:
We spent 2 nights here. The common areas, garden and pool room were all exceptional but the rooms were tired. Ours smelt of mould but the kids room seemed fine on the other side of the hallway. The bed was very comfortable though - best so far. The staff were so attentive and dressed in gorgeous uniforms. Every single one went out of their way. Location was great just on the edge of town. And the pool room was fabulous with a very patient staff member teaching us the rules of snooker. 

Breakfast was great but we ate other meals at The Grand hotel which offered more variety and better quality. So I really enjoyed our time but it could have been better.
title: Great hotel, rooms are tired

This hotel is of a bygone era. Itâ€™s a beautiful renovation of an old colonial house, and the decor and the communal areas are sympathetic to the buildingâ€™s history.  
It was freezing when we were there, so the open fires in the bars were a treat. Our room was large, cosy, and well equipped. The food was great, with a lot of choices even though it was the off season so the hotel was not fully booked. The Jetwing ethos is customer service excellence and the staff at St Andrewâ€™s certainly lived up to expectations.
title: A cosy retreat

placeInfo: {'id': '579216', 'name': "Jetwing St.Andrew's", 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2408, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.979285, 'longitude': 80.76378, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d579216-Reviews-Jetwing_St_Andrew_s-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingstandrews/', 'address': 'No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 79, 'count2': 129, 'count3': 372, 'count4': 916, 'count5': 912}}
text:
Not only beautiful from the outside but the inside gives tasteful old world charm and vibes. 
We were provided a cup of warm soup on arrival and staff wearing cardigans & grandpa hatsâ€¦  old world charm at its finest. 

The staff were friendly and attentive. 
Food was exceptional, not only with options, but taste and presentation, it all felt very high level.

The inside bar was just gorgeous, roaring fire and nice selection of drinks which were surprisingly cheaper than other hotels.  Small surcharge but much less than previous hotels we have stayed in. 

The bed super comfy, no air con in rooms but this is not needed as your are in high country and the coolest part of Sri Lanka.  An in room heater is supplied. 
Shower water pressure was brilliant and the room was excellently presented. 
No pool, but again not needed or necessary given the cooler climate. 

The grounds were stunning to walk around, very old English feels with topiary hedging and flowers galore. 

I would definitely go back to this hotel, and from our experience will base our future hotels stays within the jetwing brand. 

Honestly the best hotel we have stayed in over 16 days and multiple hotels/locations in Sri Lanka.

We were a party of six people over three rooms, this feedback of a positive experience is resounding of our breakfast conversations from all who stayed.
title: Best hotel we stayed in during our time in Sri Lanka.

roomTip: The ub is lovely with a fireplace for cool evenings. Try the Arrack.
text:
A lovely, historic lodge in Nuwara Eliya. Gardens are beautiful and enjoyed playing snooker in the game room, but miss not having a pool or better relaxing area. 

There's no A/C, and while it's cool enough not to need it most times, there are no screens on windows. The restaurant is also without A/C so can be warm dining.

The resort is on the edge of town, so not a lot of wandering opportunities close by. 

Good alternative a base to see tea plantations and national parks nearby.
title: Old School Historic Resort

placeInfo: {'id': '12864938', 'name': 'Araliya Green City', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1515, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.967575, 'longitude': 80.76695, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d12864938-Reviews-Araliya_Green_City-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.araliyagreencity.com/', 'address': 'No 01 Glen Fall Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No 01 Glen Fall Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 14, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 39, 'count4': 141, 'count5': 1305}}
roomTip: great hotel to stay at Nuwara Eliya in the heart of the city guys can walk to many places from this hotel location.
text:
We were given a great welcome by the resort team by GM Dinesh and his lovely team. 
We were warmly greeted in our own traditional Sri Lankan style which is quite an amazing experience. love the very warm tea they served at the welcome at the said premises. 

I love the well-kept neat and tidy well-presented lobby space of the hotel.  The hotel has a great vibe.   Itâ€™s a massive hotel complex situated at the heart of Nuwara Eliya city which is much closer to all attractions and can walk to most areas of the city from the said hotel. Further up on the road you meet the Grand Hotel as well which is again within walking distance from the said premises.  
The interior design of the hotel building/premiseâ€™s lobby/restaurant so unique and done very well. They do have a supermarket/Mini mart and a food court for all guests in the lobby space of the hotel. Car parks were open and underground available for guest use which is good and safe.  

We met a brilliant set of staff at Araliya Green City GM Dinesh, F&B Manager Ananda and the brilliant team of the hotel who look after us very well.  They were very kind very attentive to detail at all times. All staff members from Bell Boys, Reception with GRE team, Restaurant team, HK team, Kitchen team of Chefs on duty, and the Garden team were all exceptional at their work and service and were willing to go the extra mile for its guests.
Thank you, Team Araliya Green City boys and girls, you all are an equally amazing bunch we met during our stay. Team of Chefs thank you, for the amazing vegetarian spread of both Sri Lankan and Western cuisine given to us during our meals it was an amazing experience for us Kudos to you all guys. 

The garden area is beautifully maintained by the hotel team. Love the rose garden at the front kept very well. The room was very spacious and very clean it was a very comfortable stay for us.

Guys, we will never forget the way you all looked after us during our stay which was brilliant. Keep up the good work team Araliya Green City it was an amazing experience for us.
It took a while for me to give you this review which took a few months guys cheers.

Special Thanks to Chithra Fernando and Charith for the reservation and the help given during our stay. 
Thank you all again for your lovely hospitality extended to us hope to see you guys one day cheers.
title: Absolutely fantastic time with Araliya Green City Nuwara Eliya

roomTip: Book smaller rooms where heater works faster
text:
There was an issue during checkin. MMT had not sent the communication to the hotel so we had to wait for 30 mins. We had booked a half boat plan pkg ( dinner and breakfast) but surprisingly I had to pay for my 5 yr kid meal which was charged 7100/- at the time of check-in. Stayed in many other 5 star hotels in Srilanka and other parts of the world, no where they charged for kid except here.
Pro's : Room was clean and neat. Bigger.
Service is very good.
Walk-able to garden and market.
Buffet spread was good.
Con's:
Food for 5 yr kid chargeable @7100/- who hardly ate a bread.
Power fluctuations.
Heater not sufficient for a big room. Better book a small room where heater works faster.
Once power goes and comes, u need to switch on heater again. Remote works 1 in 4 times. So your sleep is disturbed.
Temperature controlled pool is very cold and they say that's the max temp, hence you can't use the pool.
Wifi is bad.
Service at the restaurant was very good with live singing and they sang bollywood music too.
Special mention to Vishwa, Nethmi, Madumali, Randika, Ramshan for their hospitality at the dining.
title: Pricy for a night!

text: The worst hotel I stayed in 20 years and an affront to the sri lankan tourism credibility. Sad that one of the 2 only Heritage Hotels is so badly managed and so dirty. Rooms are old, smelly and you fear getting diseases due to the level of humidity. Staff wears worn out and dirty uniforms and you better stay away from refreshing towels as the are more brown than white. Going to spa means going trough a construction site. Hospitality is not existing, staff does not care and the only touch point is the revenue manager who tries to upsell your disappointment. It maybe was Grand in the past but itâ€™s small, very small today. A shame to such a nice country that is Sri Lanka. Greedy owners that are not interested in their customers but simply in making money are a threat to the tourism industry in the country.
title: The worst hotel in 20 years

placeInfo: {'id': '579206', 'name': 'The Grand Hotel Nuwara Eliya - Heritage Grand', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3659, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.968278, 'longitude': 80.76502, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d579206-Reviews-The_Grand_Hotel_Nuwara_Eliya_Heritage_Grand-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://thegrandhotelnuwaraeliya.com', 'address': 'Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Grand Hotel Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 79, 'count2': 128, 'count3': 372, 'count4': 908, 'count5': 2173}}
roomTip: Ask for a corner room if you are looking for larger rooms. While most rooms have nice views the ones facing the garden on front - right, has the best view.
text:
Nuwara Eliya is famous for its year round mild climate, tea estates, waterfalls and colonial buildings. It was made into a resort town by the English colonists since it had a climate that they were more familiar with. There are still many remnants of colonial buildings in Nuwara Eliya and surrounding areas and one such iconic building is the Grand Hotel in Nuwara Eliya. First there has been a holiday bungalow of Sir Edward Barnes from 1820s and there has been a hotel on the location from 1890s! This hotel has now become synonymous with the beauty and heriatge of this town. 
The best thing about this hotel is that even though it is more than 100 years old, it is being carefully maintained and while you can see its an old building you would not face any of the discomforts of staying in an old building. 
We have stayed at this hotel many times over many years (its our "go-to" hotel) and their standards have always been the same in terms of perfect maintenence.  The hotel also has very well maintained gardens which they redesign for each season. It is situated in the "nicer part" of the town away from all the hustle and bustle of the Gregory Lake, with mountains as backdrop. And if you are lucky you may even get to see a small waterfall in the background (Glenfall gets activated during rainy season). 
They have a bar which has a very interesting history of its own, a temperature controlled indoor pool, a spa, a coffee shop, an Indian restaurant and a Thai restaurant in addition to their main buffet restaurant. They are also famous for their English high tea which we haven't tried yet. 
The buffet food is quite good with lots of variety. They get visitors from all parts of the world, hence you will always find many western, Indian and east Asian options in addition to the local fare. The price point of their Indian and Thai restaurants and the bar is higher than Colombo 5 star hotel prices. But we have found this to be the case in all tourist Hotspots in Sri Lanka. Hence if you are looking at the price, opting for the buffet would be a better idea since there isn't much of an incremental charge from BB to HB to FB. [But I would definitely give a 5 star rating for the food served in both the Thai and Indian restaurants.]
The hotel can get quite crowded on long weekends and school holidays since it's equally popular among tourists as well as locals. In fact the entire Nuwara Eliya town becomes a traffic jam on long weekends but as mentioned before, once you get to the Grand Hotel area you would hardly feel the crowds in the rest of the town. But the main restaurant can get quite crowded on these days just like any other resort hotel. We have always found that early breakfasts and dinners will help you avoid the crowds. 
The rooms and the bathrooms are of moderate size in line with older hotels, but special mention must be made of the fact that they always have unlimited hotwater in the bathrooms probably because they have some centralized boiler system. 
The staff has always been very friendly, efficient and accommodating, always ready to ensure that you have a lovely holiday. 
The hotel is also famous for its Christmas and New Year celebration activities as well as activities during the "April season" (generally considered the time  where you get the best weather and the roses in bloom) of which we have been part of during previous visits and we have always had a lovely time.
title: Quintessential Nuwara Eliya

text: Wow, this was something! What a hotel. Very big and absolutely luxurious (and that is saying something coming from a Swiss traveller). I would say up there with the "Leading Hotels of the World", definitely 5-star standard. Old English colony grandeur celebrated here, with 3 massive snooker tables (each apparently weighing multiple tons). Superb food and service, great pub at night. Go there, if possible for multiple days, this is the perfect English oasis in Sri Lanka!
title: Over the top - in "Leading Hotels of the World" category

text: Grand Hotel Nuwara Eliya nestled in the upcountry (highlands) has made it to my #1 hotel stay, ever!  A beautifully maintained Colonial era building with its perfectly manicured lawns and wonderful gardens attended to by friendly gardeners, is a joy to relax in. The misty, rainy weather was not only a cool relief from the searing heat of the low country, but served to enhance the awe of this retreat.  Every single staff member we encountered were courteous and wanted to assist with anything at all. Waiters seemed to know what we needed before we did and tasks were performed efficiently, silently and effortlessly. The chefs do a fantastic job and the food is fresh and tasty with a huge variety. If you come you must have high tea in the dedicated tea rooms for an unforgettable experience. A must stay hotel whenever in Sri Lanka.
title: Best hotel ever.

text:
Lovely old character hotel. Tastefully decorated and very civilized like something from a bygone era. Grand pianist playing some nights, couple of bars to choose from both with more western prices.
Large restaurant and a lovely high tea option too. A short walk into town and just up the road from a great food hall.
If you can't stay here definitely call in for a drink to soak in the ambience.
title: Grand old Hotel

roomTip: Best Hotel in Nuwara Eliya for family friends or Relax time
text:
We recently stayed at the Grand Hotel Nuwara Eliya and had a wonderful experience overall. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay memorable, with special mentions to the bell boys Kumar, Paramesh, Raja, and Francis, who were incredibly kind and attentive throughout our stay. Their warm hospitality made us feel right at home from the moment we arrived. The gym instructor, Upul, was also fantastic â€“ always present, supportive, and ready to assist with anything we needed during our workouts.

The dining experience was excellent. The food was well-prepared, and the variety on offer was impressive, catering to different tastes and preferences. We never got bored with the options available, and every meal was a pleasure. The hotelâ€™s garden is another highlight â€“ itâ€™s absolutely beautiful and well-maintained, a perfect spot to relax and take in the surrounding beauty.

Unfortunately, there were a couple of downsides. The hotel was undergoing construction during our stay, and it was quite noisy in the restaurant, which affected the otherwise peaceful ambiance. Also, the magnificent pool was closed, which was a bit disappointing as we were looking forward to using it.

On the positive side, we did enjoy a massage at the hotel spa, and the staff there were also incredibly kind. The massage itself was excellent â€“ relaxing and rejuvenating.

Despite the minor inconveniences, this is definitely a place Iâ€™d love to return to with my family. The overall charm, friendly staff, and beautiful surroundings made our stay very special. I look forward to visiting again once the renovations are complete!
title: Our time in the Grand Hotel Nuwara Eliya

text:
We stayed here during the election, hotel is differently old English from a time long ago.
Little too dark for me but the hotel food and staff were very good.
But for one Resturant
We dined in the Asian food Resturant in the basement. What happened left a bitter taste, the order was given for 7 starters and 7 mains.
The starter were right but one main course what not what was ordered, the waiter insisted that one of the girls in the party ordered a salad where as  we all ordered a curry of sorts.
We basically called her a liar when we said the order was wrong.
We returned the salad and asked for the correct meal. We were charged for the wrong item on the bill. We queried and the manager was called. This guy needs an attitude adjustment.
We asked him to review the bill (all 6 euro)
He refused, we paid in full as we thought the waiter would get in trouble but he was not nice in the way he spoke to the girls, the next day on leaving we were asked if we have any issues and explained the tale to the most wonderful lady manager on duty. Overall the staff were wonderful but the Resturant did put a massive bad taste on the visit 
Would i go back. Maybe not
title: Problem

placeInfo: {'id': '579206', 'name': 'The Grand Hotel Nuwara Eliya - Heritage Grand', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3659, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.968278, 'longitude': 80.76502, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d579206-Reviews-The_Grand_Hotel_Nuwara_Eliya_Heritage_Grand-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://thegrandhotelnuwaraeliya.com', 'address': 'Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Grand Hotel Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 79, 'count2': 128, 'count3': 372, 'count4': 908, 'count5': 2173}}
roomTip: Definitely opt for their main buffet restaurant or Indian restaurant.
text:
For our family holiday we decided to try the Grand Hotel, over our usual stops St. Andrews and Tea factory at Nuwara Eliya. Perhaps our expectations were too high but this visit certainly fell short. We booked on full board basis (which means all three meals to be included) . The first meal on arrival was lunch. We were informed that since occupancy was not sufficient, it was not buffet and we could choose from one of their restaurants and the set menu would be provided. We opted for Thai, both my husband and I loving Thai food. 
When we went to the Grand Thai, began the downward spiral of hospitality - possibly the worst in our experience of hotels in the country. 
When we placed the order and included starters for the kids (we wanted to place 2 starters of only one item, no soup, one main- as our kids are young and would not eat much)  we were told that kids were not included a dn that we could  only order two meals and that covers the kids as well  or we can order separately IF we wanted food for the kids!! 
We were definitely surprised as weâ€™ve never received such a comment from a waitress/waiter even when the meals were on set menu basis. 
They didnâ€™t take our order either and said they have to check with management. Then the restaurant supervisor also came and explained the same thing and as we were all hungry my husband said at least take the order for the two meals until the kids meals discussion was sorted. Only then did they take the order. 
After a good 20-30 minutes came the verdict that we could order ONE meal to be shared. This is fine by us, but we were given the kids menu, by the supervisor, and when we picked items off that, the waitress came and took the menu off our hands and handed the same set menu card and said that was what we had to choose from. The attitude, the way they spoke I think made all the difference. 

On the second day our room was not made up, and getting extra towels for the kids got us some pretty hostile vibes. For a place that sells tea at 1300/ I feel the staff attitudes and sense of hospitality has leaps and bounds to improve . 

On the positives the second day we opted to go to the Indian restaurant (definitely wanted to avoid the Thai restaurant like the plague!)  the experience was the complete opposite from the moment we walked through the doors. Warm, welcoming, friendly vibes from each and every member of the staff. We were assisted by a gentleman named â€œBandaraâ€ and he was so kind and considerate that even our kids immediately grew fond of him. The meal was fantastic and overall the best part of our stay at the Grand.

For parents with kids- itâ€™s nice that they have a big garden and also a small basic play area within the premises
title: Grand, was not so grand an experience

text:
The bell staff, front office, food and beverage staff and housekeeping staff were excellent. Caring and engaging service. The deluxe room 232 was not greatest from conditional stand point. We understand that the building is historical but also as hotel, the basic purpose is to put guest to sleep and feed people. Everything else is engaging and connecting experience. But we did not get the sleep as the pipes were rattling and when other guests were having shower or washroom, we could hear the water draining. The floor creeks when you walk. 

My wife is a celiac and the executive chef Mr. Lowe took great attention to her dietary needs. His culinary team and the food offering is excellent. Well done chef. 

I believe the drinks are over priced.
title: An excellent historical site to stay

placeInfo: {'id': '579206', 'name': 'The Grand Hotel Nuwara Eliya - Heritage Grand', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3659, 'locationString': 'Nuwara Eliya, Central Province', 'latitude': 6.968278, 'longitude': 80.76502, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608524-d579206-Reviews-The_Grand_Hotel_Nuwara_Eliya_Heritage_Grand-Nuwara_Eliya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://thegrandhotelnuwaraeliya.com', 'address': 'Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Grand Hotel Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Nuwara Eliya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 79, 'count2': 128, 'count3': 372, 'count4': 908, 'count5': 2173}}
text:
As part of our couples trip to various destinations around S.lanka , Nuwara Eliya was, naturally , part of the destination that we were looking forward to, especially the 2 nights booking at the Grand Hotel that we had heard so much about. The hotel premises, as expected , was beautifully laid out with all the flowers at full bloom , the garden grounds very well immaculate, beautiful walkaways for taking maximum selfies or pictures with the Grand property at the background.
The experience in the hotel though, was a real disappointment. The staff were mostly not adept and qualified to understand our requirements , the hotel was bustling with a lot of uniformed Managers but sad to say, not many of the Managers were really efficient as should be from a supposedly 4-5 star property. The F&B staff were really not very well trained and kept on running around from one corner to another to pass on our simple dietary requests without any accountability at all. A very sad and frustrating experience for all of us. We were very fortunate to meet with the top General Manager Mr Suresh Abbas before our check out and he was attentive to our issues faced during our stay, hope the Property can come up tot he same level as it once was.
The rooms were well managed but a bit to the smaller size, carpets are quite old and had a certain odor to them, location wise very nice , the piano bar had a beautiful set up, the Indian food at the Grand Indian was quite disappointing even though it was written in every review as the place to have at least one meal at Nuwara Eliya , staff attentiveness here also was not of a high caliber. Overall, not a very good stay, really hope the property can improve its standard.
title: Couples Trip to Sri lanka

roomTip: eNSURE your room is ready
text:
A beautiful old buiding with nice rooms and lovely gardens.
Other positives- the high tea and Kamal who served us
Lovely breakfast 
The bars and their staff- all to be commended

The negatives- arrived for a 3 pm check-in- very clumsy process not knowing what to do. Then told at 3.40 our room was ready, and arrived to find out it was still being cleaned at 4 pm!!! and told to sit outside for another 40 minutes!!!! Sloppy and 1 star not 5 to be told your room is ready and it wasnt - no apology, and got in very late to an expensive room as a result. 
Pushy staff wanting tips all the time too
title: Poor service in what we thought would be a great hotel. Training is needed

roomTip: A hot water indoor pool to soak in was an added feature, greatly appreciated.
text:
A very refined classy hotel retaining its British grandeur style. Well maintained and exquisitely decorated. It was a visit back to nostalgic happy memories. Food was excellent. Rooms were clean and kept to its class. The staff was friendly and helpful. However, the rigid strict rules set at check in by Top Management was most unwelcoming.  Did not match the rest of its warmth. It alienated the guest on arrival. They kept us waiting, after our long journey till evening, even when the hotel was almost empty.  Thankfully,  the front office manager and staff came to the rescue defusing the situation. May the hotel management take note of that!
Tip: Visit the Tea Lounge for a high tea experience in the tea country.
title: Visiting nostalgic memories of the Majestic British heritage hotel
